instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
this board works with a third party charger, found that out when fixing it, but does not turn on with a genuine apple charger, green light comes on for a split second then goes off. my guess is that the [COLOR=#000000][FONT= ]U7000[/FONT][/COLOR]
 is not recognizing the charger, but im at a loss on how to check what has went out . because the charger wont turn on, all i get is 1-2v anywhere, this board came in with a dead mag-safe, blown f6905, blown off the board c9000. replaced it all and it worked with my third party charger that at the time i didn't know was a third party charger. "replaced the charger with a genuine charger already"

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: First suspects are R7005/21/22, Q7080/85. I assume PPBUS is 12.56V with the fake charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
wish i had a fake charger still, we got rid of it once we found out it was fake, the customer fried theirs using a fake charger.

i will test voltages at thoes locations tomorrow when i get back into work

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: They are useful for trouble shooting.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
changed out u7000 with a board that has a bad gpu, but still powers, still nothing, tho i was confused, i removed u7000 and the green light still comes on on the bad gpu board. yet on the board im working on it wont come on. i dont have a fake charger to test it out. what am i missing?

is there a way to test [SIZE=12px][FONT=arial][COLOR=#000000]Q7080?[/COLOR][/FONT][/SIZE]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
Uhm, take the board with the bad GPU to Apple for a free repair.....
Get a fake charger for trouble shooting.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: if u7000 is removed what makes the green light still come on? my problem lies there

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: ACOK is not being pulled low by U7000. Is 3V42 present now?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: with or without u7000 i get no 3v42 power , green light for one second then it goes off, and wont come back on unless i leave it unpluged for a few min

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: Short on PPDCIN, 3V42? Also remove F7040/41 without U7000 you risk getting the full adapter voltage on PPBUS!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: the mac works with a third party charger, at least it did, if i had a short wouldnt it never have worked? it i remove the fuses 7040 and 7041 i shouldnt get any power since [FONT=arial][SIZE=12px][COLOR=#000000]PPBUS_G3H would be disconnected to the system.[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: Last time, get a fake charger for trouble shooting. Then we can go further with this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
Remove F6905. Place 18.5v from a real bench power supply on pin 2 of F6905. Then plug known good 85w charger in with known good dc in board. If it works, Q7080 is bad.

If you do as duke says and get a knockoff charger this will be easier to troubleshoot.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: ok so even putting in 18.5v in on pin 2 of f6905 and plugging in the 85w apple charger, did not give a green light. i do have a fake charger on its way, praying its fake, spending less than 20$ on it and it has no apple logo. lol, is their any more testing i can do before the new charger arrives?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: When you put 18.5V in the system the 3V42 bus should at least come high.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message:
ok got the fake charger, ppbus_h3h is 12.56. what else should i check?
R7005/21/22 all have power, r7005 is 18.5, r7021 is 19.03 and r7022 is 19.03

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: That means U7000 should be ok. Change Q7080 and check the gate voltages and resistors to U7000.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: 7080 was the problem, i had a feeling it was, is there now way to test that part?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: Not really, you can remover the gate resistors and then test if both FETs open and close. Check on youtube how to test a FET. The gate needs to be disconnected from everything to do that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2915-a no power, no green light
threads.message: awesome well next time ill have an idea how to test that little package. thank you, can i get you to close this thread please and thank you for all your help
